verses.verse: And Samson <S%H8123><s%> went <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> to Timnath, <S%H8553><s%> and saw <S%H7200><s%> a woman <S%H802><s%> in Timnath <S%H8553><s%> of the daughters <S%H1323><s%> of the Philistines. <S%H6430><s%>

And he came <S%H5927><s%> up, and told <S%H5046><s%> his father <S%H1><s%> and his mother, <S%H517><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> I have seen <S%H7200><s%> a woman <S%H802><s%> in Timnath <S%H8553><s%> of the daughters <S%H1323><s%> of the Philistines: <S%H6430><s%> now <S%H6258><s%> therefore get <S%H3947><s%> her for me to wife. <S%H802><s%>

Then his father <S%H1><s%> and his mother <S%H517><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to him, Is there never <S%H369><s%> a woman <S%H802><s%> among the daughters <S%H1323><s%> of your brothers, <S%H251><s%> or among all <S%H3605><s%> my people, <S%H5971><s%> that you go <S%H1980><s%> to take <S%H3947><s%> a wife <S%H802><s%> of the uncircumcised <S%H6189><s%> Philistines? <S%H6430><s%> And Samson <S%H8123><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to his father, <S%H1><s%> Get <S%H3947><s%> her for me; for she pleases <S%H3477><s%> <S%H5869><s%> me well.

But his father <S%H1><s%> and his mother <S%H517><s%> knew <S%H3045><s%> not that it was of the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> that he sought <S%H1245><s%> an occasion <S%H8385><s%> against the Philistines: <S%H6430><s%> for at that time <S%H6256><s%> the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> had dominion <S%H4910><s%> over Israel. <S%H3478><s%>

Then went <S%H3381><s%> Samson <S%H8123><s%> down, <S%H3381><s%> and his father <S%H1><s%> and his mother, <S%H517><s%> to Timnath, <S%H8553><s%> and came <S%H935><s%> to the vineyards <S%H3754><s%> of Timnath: <S%H8553><s%> and, behold, <S%H2009><s%> a young <S%H3715><s%> lion <S%H738><s%> roared <S%H7580><s%> against <S%H7125><s%> him.

And the Spirit <S%H7307><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> came <S%H6743><s%> mightily on him, and he rent <S%H8156><s%> him as he would have rent <S%H8156><s%> a kid, <S%H1423><s%> and he had nothing <S%H3972><s%> <S%H369><s%> in his hand: <S%H3027><s%> but he told <S%H5046><s%> not his father <S%H1><s%> or his mother <S%H517><s%> what <S%H853><s%> <S%H834><s%> he had done. <S%H6213><s%>
And he went <S%H3381><s%> down, <S%H3381><s%> and talked <S%H1696><s%> with the woman; <S%H802><s%> and she pleased <S%H3477><s%> <S%H5869><s%> Samson <S%H8123><s%> well.

And after a time <S%H3117><s%> he returned <S%H7725><s%> to take <S%H3947><s%> her, and he turned <S%H5493><s%> aside to see <S%H7200><s%> the carcass <S%H4658><s%> of the lion: <S%H738><s%> and, behold, <S%H2009><s%> there was a swarm <S%H5712><s%> of bees <S%H1682><s%> and honey <S%H1706><s%> in the carcass <S%H1472><s%> of the lion. <S%H738><s%>

And he took <S%H7287><s%> thereof in his hands, <S%H3709><s%> and went <S%H3212><s%> on eating, <S%H398><s%> and came <S%H1980><s%> to his father <S%H1><s%> and mother, <S%H517><s%> and he gave <S%H5414><s%> them, and they did eat: <S%H398><s%> but he told <S%H5046><s%> not them that he had taken <S%H7287><s%> the honey <S%H1706><s%> out of the carcass <S%H1472><s%> of the lion. <S%H738><s%>

So his father <S%H1><s%> went <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> to the woman: <S%H802><s%> and Samson <S%H8123><s%> made <S%H6213><s%> there <S%H8033><s%> a feast; <S%H4960><s%> for so <S%H3651><s%> used the young <S%H970><s%> men to do. <S%H6213><s%>
And it came <S%H1961><s%> to pass, when they saw <S%H7200><s%> him, that they brought <S%H3947><s%> thirty <S%H7970><s%> companions <S%H4828><s%> to be with him.

And Samson <S%H8123><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to them, I will now <S%H4994><s%> put <S%H2330><s%> forth <S%H2330><s%> a riddle <S%H2420><s%> to you: if <S%H518><s%> you can certainly declare <S%H5046><s%> it me within the seven <S%H7651><s%> days <S%H3117><s%> of the feast, <S%H4960><s%> and find <S%H4672><s%> it out, then I will give <S%H5414><s%> you thirty <S%H7970><s%> sheets <S%H5466><s%> and thirty <S%H7970><s%> change <S%H2487><s%> of garments: <S%H899><s%>

But if <S%H518><s%> you cannot <S%H3808><s%> <S%H3201><s%> declare <S%H5046><s%> it me, then shall you give <S%H5414><s%> me thirty <S%H7970><s%> sheets <S%H5466><s%> and thirty <S%H7970><s%> change <S%H2487><s%> of garments. <S%H899><s%> And they said <S%H559><s%> to him, Put <S%H2330><s%> forth <S%H2330><s%> your riddle, <S%H2420><s%> that we may hear <S%H8085><s%> it.

And he said <S%H559><s%> to them, Out of the eater <S%H398><s%> came <S%H3318><s%> forth <S%H3318><s%> meat, <S%H3978><s%> and out of the strong <S%H5794><s%> came <S%H3318><s%> forth <S%H3318><s%> sweetness. <S%H4966><s%> And they could <S%H3201><s%> not in three <S%H7969><s%> days <S%H3117><s%> expound <S%H5046><s%> the riddle. <S%H2420><s%>

And it came <S%H1961><s%> to pass on the seventh <S%H7637><s%> day, <S%H3117><s%> that they said <S%H559><s%> to Samson's <S%H8123><s%> wife, <S%H802><s%> Entice <S%H6601><s%> your husband, <S%H376><s%> that he may declare <S%H5046><s%> to us the riddle, <S%H2420><s%> lest <S%H6435><s%> we burn <S%H8313><s%> you and your father's <S%H1><s%> house <S%H1004><s%> with fire: <S%H784><s%> have you called <S%H7121><s%> us to take <S%H3423><s%> that we have? is it not so?

And Samson's <S%H8123><s%> wife <S%H802><s%> wept <S%H1058><s%> before <S%H5921><s%> him, and said, <S%H559><s%> You do but hate <S%H8130><s%> me, and love <S%H157><s%> me not: you have put <S%H2330><s%> forth <S%H2330><s%> a riddle <S%H2420><s%> to the children <S%H1121><s%> of my people, <S%H5971><s%> and have not told <S%H5046><s%> it me. And he said <S%H559><s%> to her, Behold, <S%H2009><s%> I have not told <S%H5046><s%> it my father <S%H1><s%> nor <S%H3808><s%> my mother, <S%H517><s%> and shall I tell <S%H5046><s%> it you?

And she wept <S%H1058><s%> before <S%H5921><s%> him the seven <S%H7651><s%> days, <S%H3117><s%> while their feast <S%H4960><s%> lasted: <S%H1961><s%> and it came <S%H1961><s%> to pass on the seventh <S%H7637><s%> day, <S%H3117><s%> that he told <S%H5046><s%> her, because <S%H3588><s%> she lay sore on him: and she told <S%H5046><s%> the riddle <S%H2420><s%> to the children <S%H1121><s%> of her people. <S%H5971><s%>

And the men <S%H582><s%> of the city <S%H5892><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to him on the seventh <S%H7637><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> before <S%H2962><s%> the sun <S%H2775><s%> went <S%H935><s%> down, <S%H3381><s%> What <S%H4100><s%> is sweeter <S%H4966><s%> than honey? <S%H1706><s%> And what <S%H4100><s%> is stronger <S%H5794><s%> than a lion? <S%H738><s%> and he said <S%H559><s%> to them, If <S%H3884><s%> you had not plowed <S%H2790><s%> with my heifer, <S%H5697><s%> you had not found <S%H4672><s%> out my riddle. <S%H2420><s%>

And the Spirit <S%H7307><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> came <S%H6743><s%> on him, and he went <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> to Ashkelon, <S%H831><s%> and slew <S%H5221><s%> thirty <S%H7970><s%> men <S%H376><s%> of them, and took <S%H3947><s%> their spoil, <S%H2488><s%> and gave <S%H5414><s%> change <S%H2487><s%> of garments to them which expounded <S%H5046><s%> the riddle. <S%H2420><s%> And his anger <S%H639><s%> was kindled, <S%H2734><s%> and he went <S%H5927><s%> up to his father's <S%H1><s%> house. <S%H1004><s%>
But Samson's <S%H8123><s%> wife <S%H802><s%> was given to his companion, <S%H4828><s%> whom <S%H834><s%> he had used as his friend. <S%H7462><s%>
